data.question: What is the empirical formula of Al-bttotb?
data.answer: C54 H33 Al3 O21

data.question: At what temperature was Al-bttotb synthesized solvothermally?
What is the BET surface area of Al-bttotb?
Does Al-bttotb adsorb 22DMB?
data.answer: No, it shows essentially no adsorption toward 22DMB.

data.question: What is the kinetic diameter of 3MP?
Can Al-bttotb separate linear and monobranched alkanes from their dibranched isomers?
data.answer: Yes, it adsorbs linear and monobranched alkanes only and excludes their dibranched isomers.

data.question: What is the purpose of using helium in adsorption simulations?
data.answer: To sketch the profile of the channels in Al-bttotb.

data.question: Is Al-bttotb stable after being heated at 180 °C in open air?
data.answer: Yes, the structure of Al-bttotb is well-retained after being heated at 180 °C in open air.

data.question: What method was used for computational calculations in the study?
data.answer: Density Functional Theory (DFT)

data.question: What is the crystal system of Al-bttotb?
data.answer: Orthorhombic

data.question: Does Al-bttotb have a uniform pore size?
data.answer: Yes, it has a uniform pore size of 5.6 Å.

data.question: What is the role of formic acid in the synthesis of Al-bttotb?
data.answer: It is part of the mixed solvent used in the solvothermal synthesis.

data.question: Was Al-bttotb's adsorption capacity for nHEX lost after six adsorption–desorption cycles?
data.answer: No, no loss of adsorption capacity was observed after six adsorption–desorption cycles.

data.question: What is the main advantage of Al-bttotb over zeolite 5A for alkane separation?
data.answer: Al-bttotb can separate linear and monobranched alkanes from their dibranched isomers, unlike zeolite 5A.

data.question: What is the significance of the BET surface area measurement for Al-bttotb?
data.answer: It helps determine the material's surface area and pore volume, indicating its adsorption capacity.

data.question: Is Al-bttotb capable of adsorbing 3MP?
data.answer: Yes, Al-bttotb adsorbs 3MP.

data.question: What is the effect of the pore size of Al-bttotb on its adsorption properties?
data.answer: The pore size allows for selective adsorption of linear and monobranched alkanes while excluding dibranched isomers.

data.question: What is the role of nitrogen adsorption measurements in the study?
data.answer: To determine the surface area and pore volume of Al-bttotb.

data.question: Can Al-bttotb be used for the adsorptive separation of alkane isomers?
data.answer: Yes, it can be used for the adsorptive separation of alkane isomers.

data.question: What is the significance of the crystal structure analysis for Al-bttotb?
data.answer: It helps understand the material's framework and pore dimensions, crucial for its selective adsorption properties.
